description: A small mini-macaw, primarily green with a blue forehead and a large maroon patch on its belly. They have a distinctive yellow bare facial patch.
temperament: Known to be shy, gentle, and quiet compared to other macaws. They can be very affectionate but are also sensitive and can be easily stressed.
loudness: Quiet to Moderate. One of the quietest macaws, with a higher-pitched, less harsh call.
loudness_icon: <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="w-12 h-12 text-green-500" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="currentColor" aria-hidden="true" role="img" aria-label="Quiet"><title>Quiet</title><path d="M7 9v6h4l5 5V4l-5 5H7z"></path></svg>
vocalization: Not known for talking ability. Their vocalizations are generally soft and chattering.
dietaryNeeds: Highly specialized diet. In the wild, they feed almost exclusively on the fruit of Moriche palm trees. Captive diets must be carefully managed to be low in fat and high in beta-carotene.
healthPointers: Can live 30-40 years. Considered delicate and difficult to maintain in captivity due to their specialized diet. Prone to digestive issues and vitamin deficiencies.
housing: A medium-sized cage is adequate, at least 24"W x 24"D x 36"H. Their quieter nature makes them better suited for home environments than other macaws.
